name: shortchange
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to give someone back less money than they are owed when the person is buying something from you: I think I was shortchanged in the café, because I've only got £5 in my purse when I should have £10.
to treat someone unfairly, by giving them less than they deserve: Children who leave school unable to read and write are being tragically shortchanged.
